Alright. In this challenge you have to pick one of your poor kerbals and have him circumnavigate Kerbin by foot (and by swimming). The person with the lowest time wins.

PLACES

1.

2.

3.

Nobody will do this. Ever. Kerbals walk, swim and run at a very, very slow pace. At 4x physical timewarp, I'd be surprised if anyone took less than a real-time week.

Yeah, just getting to the water takes over half an hour of in-game time.

The horribleness of Desert bus pales in comparison to this challenge. Desert bus is only 8 hours. The world-record score is 5 points, or 40 hours. This challenge would take several hundred hours on max timewarp.

Kerbal has an equatorial circumference of ~4000 kilometers. Walking around Kerbin is roughly equivalent in distance to walking the entire pacific crest trail. PCT hikers usually take 6 months to do that IRL.

Kerbin just isn't an interesting enough place to convince me to want to walk anywhere beyond the KSC, let alone around the entire planet.
